section.name: File and Folder Commands Summary
section.t: The file operations (FileOp) have protocol names. Here are their protocol names and a breif description.
Implementations are not required to support any or all of these commands.

tr.td: When sent as a command, request the list of folder commands supported. When sent as a reply, includes the list of folder commands supported.
Create a new folder. Also the name of the capability for this permission.
Copy a folder. Also the name of the capability for this permission.
Delete a folder. Also the name of the capability for this permission.
Rename a folder. Also the name of the capability for this permission.
Get, set, and update information associated with the folder. File meta data is also returned with the FOLDER_OPEN command.
Move a folder. Also the name of the capability for this permission.
Open a folder and get information about the folder and files in the folder.
Share a folder. Also the name of the capability for this permission.
List folders and files. Also the name of the capability for this permission.
Create a new file. Also the name of the capability for this permission.
Copy a file. Also the name of the capability for this permission.
Delete a file. Also the name of the capability for this permission.
Rename a file. Also the name of the capability for this permission.
Get, set, and update information associated with the folder. File meta data is also returned with the FOLDER_OPEN command.
Move a file. Also the name of the capability for this permission.
Share a file. Also the name of the capability for this permission.
Get a file. Also the name of the capability for this permission.
Modify the contents of an existing file. Also the name of the capability for this permission.
